form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Heitkamp (for herself and Mr. Inhofe) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to recognize Indian tribal governments for purposes of determining under the adoption credit whether a child has special needs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tribal Adoption Parity Act.

section.header: Recognizing Indian tribal governments for purposes of determining under the adoption credit whether a child has special needs

subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 23(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (defining child with special needs) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by inserting or Indian tribal government after the words a State; and
in subparagraph (B), by inserting or Indian tribal government after the words such State.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
